title: Beetroot Hummus & Roast Veg Bowl
keywords: Beetroot hummus, Roasted vegetables, Buddha bowl, Vegetarian, Middle Eastern, Plant-based

method.step: Preheat the oven to 200C / 180C (fan) / gas 6 and boil a kettle
Separate your Olive Oil into 2/10, 2/10, 2/10, 4/10
Drain your beetroot in a colander over the sink
Chop the drained into wedges
Add your butternut squash cubes, garlic and half of the beetroot wedges to a baking tray
Drizzle with olive oil and season with a pinch of salt
Put the tray(s) in the oven for an initial 10-15 minutes
While the veg is roasting, add your bulgur wheat to a pot with plenty of boiled water and a pinch of salt
Bring to the boil over a heigh heat and cook for 7-9 minutes or until tender with a slight bite
Once cooked, drain and return to the pot
Meanwhile, drain and rinse your chickpeas
Cut your lemon(s) into quarters
Add the remaining beetroot wedges into the food processor with half the drained chickpeas, your tahini and a squeeze of lemon juice
Add 2/10 of your original olive oil, your cold water and a generous pinch of salt and blitz smooth.  This is your beetroot hummus

After an initial 10-15 minutes, add the remaining chickpeas to the tray(s) with the vegetables, sprinkle over your ground cumin, then drizzle with 2/10 of your origional left over olive oil and give it a good mix up
Add your tenderstem broccoli to the tray(s) drizzle with the 2/10 of your original olive oil and pinch of salt
Return the trays to the oven for a further 10-15 minutes or until everything is cooked through and golden
Meanwhile, add a small squeeze of lemon juice the remaining olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper to a small bowl and stir it all together
Once the vegetables are cooked, squeeze the roasted garlic from its skin into the bowl and discard the skin
Mash the roasted garlic with a fork and whisk it to the dressing whisk is your roasted garlic dressing
Wash your salad then pat it dry with kitchen paper
Serve the beetroot hummus with the bulgur wheat salad and roasted veg to the side
Drizzle the roasted garlic dressing all over and garnish with the remaining lemon wedges
Garnish with your nigella seeds and enjoy
